title: Jennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez donate a year's worth of food to school
text:
Jennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez are doing their part to prevent child hunger.

The couple revealed they have donated a year's supply of food to a school in Tennessee, after hearing how teachers there banded together to feed a hungry student.

Elementary school teacher Brooke Goins revealed on Facebook earlier this month that she enlisted the help of her fellow instructors to buy food for a pupil who did not have enough to eat and was relying on the school for sustenance.

Doing good: Jennifer Lopez and her fiance Alex Rodriguez have donated a year's supply of food to an elementary school after teachers there fed a hungry child

Moved by the story, Jennifer, 50, and her fiance, 44, announced Thursday they had decided to donate a year's supply of food from Tiller & Hatch, which they are both part owners of.

'When we heard about the students and amazing teachers at Jacksboro Elementary in Tennessee, we knew we had to help. We heard teachers were helping students bring home food when they didn't have enough,' Jennifer said.

'When we saw this story, it brought tears not just to my eyes, but Alex's as well! I don’t know if you guys know, but Alex and I are part owners in a company called Tiller & Hatch, and we decided to donate a years worth of of their yummy, healthy meals, for the students and their school’s food pantry.

'This is why being a business owner, and having actual ownership in companies (not licensing), is so important to me and Alex, especially as Latinos. It's about showing our community, this is what life can be. You can take charge and take ownership. It allows us to have a say in creating things that make people's lives better and have partners that share our passion for giving back. Because giving back and being there for others is really what matters most.

Special delivery: The video begins with a man announcing Tiller & Hatch had donated food after hearing the story of the hungry child

Making an impact: Elementary school teacher Brooke Goins revealed on Facebook earlier this month that she enlisted the help of her fellow instructors to buy food for a pupil who did not have enough to eat at home

Making a cameo: Lopez and her fiance addressed the teacher and her students over video chat

'We are happy to be in business with partners who also believe no child should EVER have to go to sleep hungry. Everyone should have access to delicious, nutritious food. This was my favorite moment of the month and it’s one of the best things we’ve been able to do. @tillerandhatch #tillerandhatch.'

Jennifer included a video capturing the moment the food was donated to the school, as she spoke with the children and teacher Brooke via video chat.

'We were so touched, we were so moved,' Jennifer began in a video chat alongside her fiance. 'Alex messaged me, oh my god we were crying. You know, my mom was a teacher, and it was such a moving story to us that we wanted to help.'

Personal: Lopez had a personal connection to the matter, as her own mother was a teacher

'We're involved in a company called Tiller and Hatch,' A-Rod said.

'The student that you wrote about on Facebook, we're sending you a year's worth of meals,' Jennifer continued. 'I hope this helps.'

Alex also posted the same video to his account, writing in the caption, 'This story brought tears to my eyes and I’m so happy we were able to help these wonderful kids out. Giving back is truly what matters most.'

Jennifer and Alex became engaged in March 2019, after two years of dating.
description: The couple revealed they have donated a year's supply of food to a school in Tennessee, after hearing how teachers there banded together to feed a hungry student.
